description.value:
This toxin is a compound of arsenic and other substances. You can't reduce your sickened condition while affected.

Activate A Interact (Ingested)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:18]

Onset 10 minutes

Maximum Duration 5 minutes

Stage 1 [[/r 1d4[poison]]] damage and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 minute)

Stage 2 [[/r 1d6[poison]]] damage and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} (1 minute)

Stage 3 [[/r 2d6[poison]]] damage and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3} (1 minute)

A single spear frog yields enough toxin to Craft 1 dose of spear frog poison.

Activate D Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:15]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r 1d4[poison]]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r 1d6[poison]]] damage and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Giant centipede venom causes severe muscle stiffness.

Activate D Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:17]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r 1d6[poison]]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r 1d8[poison]]] damage and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} (1 round)

Stage 3 [[/r 1d12[poison]]] damage, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, and off-guard (1 round)

Sometimes called "deadly nightshade", belladonna is a widely available toxin produced from a plant similar to a tomato.

Activate D Interact (Ingested)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:19]

Onset 10 minutes

Maximum Duration 30 minutes

Stage 1 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} (10 minutes)

Stage 2 [[/r 1d6[poison]]] damage and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (10 minutes)

Stage 3 [[/r 1d6[poison]]] damage, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}, and sickened 1 (1 minute)

Many calignis use a debilitating poison crafted from subterranean fungi.

Activate T Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:16]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r 1d6[poison]]] damage and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 As stage 1

Stage 3 [[/r 1d6[poison]]] damage, and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

Adder venom is a simple but effective way to enhance a weapon.

Activate D Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:18]

Maximum Duration 3 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r 1d8[poison]]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r 1d10[poison]]] damage (1 round)

Stage 3 [[/r 2d6[poison]]] damage (1 round)

Traps may keep many a thief at bay, but the poison known as looter's lethargy ensures that no thieves are strong enough to walk off with pilfered treasures. Commonly smeared on locks, chests, and even valuable items themselves, the poison slowly saps the strength of those who touch it. Nearby guardians can then simply follow the resulting trail of discarded valuables to find the weakened trespasser.

Activate 1 Interact (Contact)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:19]

Onset 1 minute

Maximum Duration 1 hour

Stage 1 reduce Bulk limit by 3 (1 minute)

Stage 2 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}, reduce Bulk limit by 4 (10 minutes)

Stage 3 off-guard, reduce Bulk limit by 5 (10 minutes)

publication.title: Pathfinder #157: Devil at the Dreaming Palace

description.value:
Toad tears can be mixed with any other foodstuff or drink, but the poison can also be ingested as is. The process of refining giant toad poison lessens its deadly qualities, and as a result, toad tears are rarely directly fatal. Yet those who are exposed to toad tears often lose control of their actions, making it a dangerous poison nevertheless.

Activate A Interact (Ingested)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:19]

Onset 5 minutes

Maximum Duration 30 minutes

Stage 1 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (10 minutes)

Stage 2 stupefied 1 and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} (1 minute)

Lethargy poison is commonly used in hit-and-run tactics by drow and others who want their victims alive; the ambusher retreats until the poison sets in and the victim falls unconscious. Further exposure to lethargy poison does not require the target to attempt additional saving throws; only failing an saving throw against an ongoing exposure can progress its stage.

Activate D Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:18]

Maximum Duration 4 hours

Stage 1 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 slowed 1 (1 minute)

Stage 3 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} with no Perception check to wake up (1 round)

Stage 4 unconscious with no Perception check to wake up ([[/br 1d4 #hours]]{1d4 hours}).

The powdered pollen from a yellow musk creeper addles the mind.

Activate A Interact (Inhaled)

Saving Throw @Check[type:will|dc:16]

Maximum Duration 2 rounds

Stage 1 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by the poison cloud (1 round)

Stage 2 fascinated by the poison cloud, and can use no actions but to move closer to the cloud's point of origin (1 round)

Boggards brew a potent toxin made from blue dragonflies. Swampseers consume this mixture to awaken their divine powers, but the poison inspires crippling hallucinations in most other creatures.

Activate A Interact (Ingested)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:17]

Onset 10 minutes

Maximum Duration 30 minutes

Stage 1 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} (10 minutes)

Stage 2 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (10 minutes)

Stage 3 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} (1 minute)

This thick substance is distilled from the mind-robbing cytillesh fungus, though it lacks memory-altering capabilities.

Activate D Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:19]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r 1d10[poison]]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r 1d12[poison]]] damage (1 round)

Stage 3 [[/r 2d10[poison]]] damage (1 round)

The opaque white sap from the graveroot shrub clouds the mind.

Activate D Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:19]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r 1d10[poison]]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r 1d12[poison]]] damage and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 3 [[/r 2d6[poison]]] damage and stupefied 2 (1 round)

The delicate process of extracting violet venom from a violet fungus leaves it diluted at the best of times. Alchemists are still on the hunt for a truly pure, unadulterated version of this highly toxic poison.

Activate A Interact (Contact)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:17]

Onset 1 minute

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r 1d6[poison]]] damage plus @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r 1d6[poison]]] damage plus @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 round)

Stage 3 [[/r 2d6[poison]]] damage plus enfeebled 1 (1 round)

Once injected, this synthetic toxin sinks into the extremities, numbing them nearly to paralysis.

Activate 2 Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r 1d10[poison]]] damage and -5-foot status penalty to all Speeds (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r 2d6[poison]]] damage and -10-foot status penalty to all Speeds (1 round)

Stage 3 [[/r 2d6[poison]]] damage and -20-foot status penalty to all Speeds (1 round)

Typically used to fake one's death, this poison swiftly causes the imbiber to lose consciousness and suppresses vital signs. A creature examining the unconscious target must succeed at a Medicine check against the imbiber's Deception DC + 4 to determine that the target is alive, and a critical success allows the examiner to determine that a toxin is causing the effect. The false death toxin has an extremely bitter taste (Perception DC 10 to detect), making it difficult to trick a creature into consuming the poison against its wishes.

Activate A Interact

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:18]

Onset 10 minutes

Maximum Duration 5 days

Stage 1clumsy 2 (1 round)

Stage 2 unconscious (1 hour)

Stage 3 unconscious (1 day)

This venom erodes its target's defenses, aiding the spider in securing prey.

Activate D Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:21]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r 1d10[poison]]] damage and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r 1d12[poison]]] damage, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, and off-guard (1 round)

Stage 3 [[/r 2d6[poison]]] damage, clumsy 2, and off-guard (1 round)

This tiny serrated dagger looks like a miniature sawtooth sabre. Until activated, it is too small and ornamental to function as a weapon, which might allow it to be passed off as a weapon-shaped decoration.

Activate A Interact

Effect You transform the dagger of eternal sleep into a +1 @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.qUnDHEXteUQGE8yp]{Grievous} striking dagger and Strike an unconscious target with the dagger.

If you are not in an encounter or otherwise threatened and you roll a hit with your Strike, you get a critical hit instead. The damage from the Strike and the bleed from the critical specialization effect do not awaken the target, though the target becomes temporarily immune to this effect until the next time it wakes up, meaning further daggers of eternal sleep awaken it as normal. The dagger disintegrates immediately after use.

The serrated blade of this +1 striking dagger has a greenish tinge, and the hilt is sculpted to look like the head of a serpent about to strike.

When you critically succeed at an attack roll with the dagger of venom, the target becomes sickened 1 unless it succeeds at a DC 19 Fortitude save. This is a poison effect.

In addition, you can activate the dagger to poison a creature with a more potent poison.

Activate F Interact

Frequency once per day

Trigger You damage a creature with the dagger of venom

Effect You poison the creature you hit with dagger venom.

Dagger Venom (poison)

Saving Throw Fortitude DC 21

Maximum Duration 4 rounds.

Stage 1 1d8 poison damage and enfeebled 1.

This +1 striking dagger has an image of a snake emblazoned on its blade. When you critically succeed at an attack roll with the dagger, magical fangs emerge and poison the target, dealing @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Poison1d4.success].

You need thieves' tools to Pick Locks or Disable Devices (of some types) using the Thievery skill.

If your thieves' tools are broken, you can repair them by replacing the lock picks with @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.Sw7MBLASN3xK4Y44]{Replacement Picks} appropriate to your tools; this doesn't require using the Repair action.

You need thieves' tools to Pick Locks or Disable Devices (of some types) using the Thievery skill. Infiltrator thieves' tools add a +1 item bonus to checks to Pick Locks and Disable Devices.

If your thieves' tools are broken, you can repair them by replacing the lock picks with @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.BznmPaRjI4Orb0IH]{Replacement Picks} appropriate to your tools; this doesn't require using the Repair action.
These are replacement picks for @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.zvLyCVD8g2PdHJAc]{Thieves' Tools}.
These are replacement picks for @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.6nrCxNQFycUVFOV2]{Thieves' Tools (Infiltrator)}.

You need thieves' tools to Pick Locks or Disable Devices (of some types) using the Thievery skill. Infiltrator thieves' tools add a +1 item bonus to checks to Pick Locks and Disable Devices.

Smaller and made of stronger materials than most sets of thieves' tools, the items in this kit are much easier to conceal. You gain a +1 item bonus to Stealth checks to Conceal these tools.

If your thieves' tools are broken, you can repair them by replacing the lock picks with @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.TxMFNfkoccirCitP]{Replacement Picks} appropriate to your tools; this doesn't require using the Repair action.

publication.title: Pathfinder Lost Omens: Pathfinder Society Guide

description.value: These are replacement picks for @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.Ejmv9IHGp9Ad9dgu]{Thieves' Tools (Concealable)}.

publication.title: Pathfinder Lost Omens: Pathfinder Society Guide

description.value:
This long, thin +1 striking @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.fo6Yhq5mbQXsnZs0]{Wounding} dagger has a smooth edge on one side and a serrated edge on the other.

Its persistent bleed damage comes from slicing away long strips of the target's flesh, and it deals @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed1d8.success] on a hit instead of 1d6. A creature takes a -2 status penalty to saving throws against diseases for as long as it has persistent bleed damage from this knife.
